title: Why is my landlord doing a building inspection during a pandemic?
text:
\*Note: The landlord posted two days notice to tenants in the building for inspection per RHA. 

I just tried to call our property management, Excel Properties, asking why they feel it is necessary to have two people enter the apartment and the subsequent units during a pandemic to perform an inspection. I called property management to voice my concerns about the risk for myself and the other tenants (not to mention the people entering the building) and was met with a rather argumentative and dismissive phone conversation with the owner. 

Under normal circumstances, she's in her legal right to perform an inspection - but how about during these times? Is anyone else experiencing weird property management issues during this pandemic?
